channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
@jeffjarvis @bluesky Software takes time. Replicating the functionality of a system thatâ€™s huge in complexity and scale while changing its underlying design, think about any other field, imagine rebuilding the nyc subway in a year or two with one of the basic constraints changed.
@jeffjarvis @bluesky People expect miracles of software mostly because they donâ€™t understand how itâ€™s made but itâ€™s pretty much like everything else, if it took a long time to make it the first time itâ€™s going to take almost as much time the second and thatâ€™s assuming youâ€™re cloning it.
I donâ€™t envy the bluesky people. Everyone is watching with great expectation and theyâ€™ve bit off the problem of federating a closed system that has been built over sixteen years.
Iâ€™ve been programming for 49 years.
December 2021: My product is interop. https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf
I just solved @washingtonpost's crossword. https://t.co/5Q1xCSALtm
Of Course the Constitution Has Nothing to Say About Abortion (it makes no mention of women). https://t.co/a0lQpxV5AF

@arimelber -- you should have @ElieNYC as a special guest to do a rendition on his chapter in this latest book about abortion. His book is a master class, the chapter on abortion is the best explanation of the issues I've heard. Opened my eyes and mind.
@tconfrey @bmann @blaine OPML has been around since the late 90s. It's not a newcomer pretending to unify all previous formats. We were making lots of outlines, so we needed a format for interop.

@tconfrey @bmann @blaine I'm very interested in interop between outliners. https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf OPML is a widely supported format. I understand you prefer another format. Please concisely tell us more about it. Some example files would help. Is there a spec?
@wmf what do you think?
Itâ€™s Time to Rage. https://t.co/IlStF7CHRE
@BarbMcQuade That's why I think it must be Ginni Thomas.

@jeffjarvis As someone who lived in Silicon Valley for 30 years, let me tell you -- it was totally a documentary. I think I was actually in a few episodes myself (names changed). It certainly captured the lifestyle. I thought I was going to hate it but I loved it.

@daverpvb They didn't lie. If you listen carefully they said it's a precedent, which was true. These were carefully crafted talking points, obviously all coming from the same place, to help people who want to believe they won't overturn the precedent believe it, without lying.
The government doesn't have any business regulating religion, and when life begins is a religious question. https://t.co/at85KUcAd6

@johnrobb no doubt.
@johnrobb I don;t think "stolen" or "thief" applies, the property that was published belongs to the United States, and we are the United States, so they're just disclosing something we already own.
@jeremyzilar I give up.

The Supreme Court is protects the rights of Americans. Theyâ€™re not a religious body, they are not chartered to adjudicate religious questions, because there is no religion attached to our government. That part is in the text of the Constitution, for our textualist friends.
The Roe opinion and the case against the Supreme Court of the United States. https://t.co/I6G5KW7RXw
@JRubinBlogger Hope
